p: The antibacterial effect was determined using seven strains of bacteria which were brought from the American Type Culture Collection (ATCC): Pseudomonas aeruginosa (ATCC 9027), Escherichia coli (ATCC 25922), Klebsiella pneumonia, (ATCC 13883), Proteus vulgaris (ATCC 8427), Enterococcus faecium (ATCC 700221), and Staphylococcus aureus (ATCC 25923) as well as against the growth of a diagnostically confirmed Methicillin-Resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA). The antifungal activity of (PJ) samples was evaluated against the growth of Candida albicans (ATCC 90028). However, the antimicrobial activity of (PJ) four fractions used in this study was estimated using the broth microdilution method (7, 8).
